oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Experimental Infection Models for Evaluating in vivo Efficacy of Antibiotics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Garg, Ramesh C.
Powers, Thomas E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: in vivo efficacy
Streptococcus zooepidemicus
Klebsiella pneumonia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In vivo efficacy studies of antimicrobial drugs are important to bridge the gap between their in vitro activity and clinical trial results. Such studies are usually conducted in rodents, but they have several imitations. In veterinary therapy, unlike in human medicine, the in vivo efficacy can experimentally be investigated in target species.
